page.title: 08ATTITUDES
page.content: {SHOPPING SURVEY (cont'd) Most of the shoppers had travelled to the centre either by car or bus,some of them travelling up to 5 miles.The future of the centre could therefore depend upon the provision of improved car parking facilities and local bus services.Already there are problems with the annexing of the Ynys car park by the new Aberdare by-pass.This area may now only be reached by a high foot bridge. In the last 3 years some supermarkets have moved out of the centre into the surrounding residential districts.Here they provide car parks and in some cases a free bus service e.g. Kwiksave.In the survey 8% of those surveyed bought the bulk of their shopping in these supermarkets,a trend which could threaten the future of shopping in Aberdare centre.
